Dear Ms. Leapheart:
Attached is the Interim Report for the above referenced facility completed on 12/21/2020.
Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, sections of the contract and Modified
Implementation, Sustainability and Settlement Agreement (MISEP) requirements, a
written corrective action plan is required. It should be noted that violations of any licensing
rules are also violations of the MISEP and your contract. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
licensing statute and rule or section of the contract or MISEP citation.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
1.) The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except
for the following:
R 400.12306 Application request.
(4) An agency shall document that the licensee has been
given an application for renewal of the license not less than
60 calendar days before the expiration date of the license.
One of the three current foster home files reviewed included documentation the
applicant was not given an application for the renewal of the license at least 60
calendar days before the expiration date of the license. In this file the license had an
expiration date of 02/05/2021 and the application for the renewal of the license was
given to the applicant 01/08/2021.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited 10/16/2020 RENEWAL,
CAP Approved 10/21/2020.
R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(4) An agency shall document placement specifications
consistent with the information contained in the reevaluation.
The placement specifications shall include all of the following:
(a) Age,
One of the three current foster home files reviewed included an annual evaluation
that recommended a different age range for appropriate placements than the age
range identified in the corresponding license (3706). In this file the annual
reevaluation dated 11/30/2021 recommended an age range of 3-8 years and the
corresponding license (3706) had an age range of 4-12 years.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited 10/16/2020 RENEWAL,
CAP Approved 10/21/2020.
3

R 400.12324 Reevaluation.
(8) An agency shall complete a reevaluation and shall make a
licensing recommendation to the department at least 15
calendar days before the expiration date of the foster home
license.
One of the three current foster home files reviewed contained documentation that
indicated the licensing recommendation was not submitted to the department at
least 15 calendar days before the expiration date of the license. In this file the
expiration date of the license was 06/09/2021 and the recommendation submitted to
the department for the renewal was signed 07/19/2021.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited 10/16/2020 RENEWAL,
CAP Approved 10/21/2020.
R 400.12326 Borrowed home.
(1) Before placing a child in a foster home certified by another
agency or tribe, the agency shall have a record containing all of
the following documents:
(h) A copy of the current children's foster home license
application and children's foster home licensing transaction
record documents from the certifying agency.
Two of the three borrowed home files reviewed did not include a copy of the current
licensing transaction document (3706). In the first file the most recent copy of the
license had an expiration date of 08/03/2021 and the second file had an expiration
date of 03/27/2021.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(1) An agency shall do all of the following when anyone in the
agency receives information that relates to possible
noncompliance with any foster home rule:
(d) Notify all social service workers who have children placed
in the home that a special evaluation has been initiated.
Three of the three special evaluations that were reviewed did not include
documentation in the report the social services worker with children placed in the
home was notified a special evaluation had been initiated on the home. The three
special evaluations reviewed had intake dates of 05/20/21, 04/26/21, and 10/26/21.
4

R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(5) Within 15 days of the conclusion of the evaluation, an
agency shall complete a written report that includes all of the
following information:
(d) Dates and places of contacts, names of persons
interviewed, and names of the interviewers. If children are
interviewed, their last names shall not be included in the report.
Two of the three special evaluations reviewed included the last name of the child
interviewed in the completed special evaluation report. The two special evaluations
were dated 05/20/21 and 4/26/21.
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(6) An agency shall do all of the following:
(b) Inform the foster parent, in writing, that he or she has
a right to have his or her written response included as an
attachment to the report required by subrule (5) of this
rule.
(c) Provide a copy of the report to any social services
worker that has children placed in the home.
Three of the three special evaluations reviewed did not include documentation the
foster parent was informed in writing that they could have their written response
included as an attachment to the report (b) and that the social services worker(s)
with children in the home was given a copy of the completed special evaluation
report (c).
R 400.12327 Special evaluation.
(7) If any violations are cited and there is a signed corrective
action plan, all social services workers who have children placed
in the home shall be notified there is a corrective action plan and
what is required of the foster parent in that plan.
Two of the three special evaluations completed determined noncompliance with at
least one foster home rule and a corrective action plan was required. There was no
documentation to indicate the social services worker(s) was notified there was a
corrective action plan and the contents/expectations of that plan.
5

R 400.12507 Medical/dental and mental health care.
(1) An agency shall ensure that a youth in independent living
receives any needed medical, dental, and mental health care as
required in R 400.12413. Medical, dental, and mental health
care provided shall be documented in the youth’s record.
Two of the three independent living youth records reviewed indicated the youth did
not have medical and/or dental examinations as required by this rule. The first youth
had an updated physical examination due 5/22/20 and there was no documentation
this exam had been completed. The second youth had an updated dental
examination due 4/2/21 and there was no documentation this dental exam had been
completed. Neither record had documentation of a waiver to indicate these exams
would not be required.
2.) Any violation listed in section 1 is also an MISEP violation. Please note that there
are additional MISEP requirements that may not be included in section 1. The
facility is in compliance will all additional MISEP requirements except for the
following:
ISEP 4.22 MiSACWIS (Commitment 22). DHHS will maintain an operational
statewide automated child welfare information system (“MiSACWIS”) which
will be the primary tracking system and satisfy federal reporting
requirements.
Some files of information/documentation that were not uploaded into the
MISACWIS information system or could not be located in the system as a part of
this review were four signed/dated Updated Service Plans and five signed/dated
Parent/Agency Treatment Plans.
REPEAT VIOLATION ESTABLISHED (Previously cited 10/16/2020

VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were two incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Both incidents were investigated and neither incident substantiated abuse/neglect.
A corrective action plan was required in each of the situations with no change in the
licensing status. The corrective action plans included additional training by the
caregivers which were completed 08/24/21 and 09/17/21 respectively.
AND
The agency has submitted one acceptable corrective action plan not related to
maltreatment during this licensing period.
The agency submitted a corrective action plan for the renewal evaluation completed
10/16/2020. Areas identified in noncompliance as a part of that review were Rules
306(4), 324(4)(a)(b)(d) (8), 418(2)(b), 421(b), and ISEP 4.22. Areas identified as
repeat noncompliance as a part of this interim evaluation were Rules 324(4)(a) (8),
306(4), and ISEP 4.22.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrator Assessment included a review of areas of noncompliance
from the previous evaluation and an assessment of barriers that contributed to the
noncompliance. One of the activities presented in the assessment was the hiring of
additional child welfare staff to reduce the caseload/activities for case managers.
Interviews
Child welfare staff were involved in both entrance and exit conferences with no
concerns being presented.
VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The DCWL Analyst identified one safety concern as follows:
An agency worker visited the home and discussed the alert with the relative
caregiver and confirmed a door alarm had been installed and was operational. A
safety plan was also developed between the relative caregiver and the agency to
ensure the childs safety.
Safety Alert: An unlicensed relative had a small pool in the backyard and there was
no barrier around the pool or door alarms on the doors leading to the backyard.
Resolution:
Pictures confirming the resolution were also submitted for confirmation.
7

VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules and/or MISEP requirements and/or contract/policy.
Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it is recommended that the
facility continue on a regular license.
